cyclone.name: FLORENCE
cyclone.current_location: about 100 miles ESE of Wilmington, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Florence is creeping toward the southern North Carolina coast, forecast to drift slowly west-southwest across the Carolinas, then arc north and northeast across the Mid-Atlantic states early next week.

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm-surge watch from Edisto Beach SC to South Santee River SC and north of Duck NC to the NC/VA border; hurricane watch Edisto Beach SC to South Santee River SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane warning South Santee River SC to Duck NC including Albemarle & Pamlico Sounds; storm-surge warning South Santee River SC to Duck NC; tropical-storm warning north of Duck NC to Cape Charles Light VA and lower Chesapeake Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Greatest coastal impacts along the North Carolina and northeastern South Carolina shores, spreading inland across the Carolinas and eventually into the Mid-Atlantic region
weather_observation.wind: Only a small (≤3 %) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; gusty easterly/northeasterly winds possible early next week.
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant storm-surge threat for New York Harbor from Florence.
weather_observation.rainfall: Remnant moisture may bring 1-3 in of rain (locally higher) Mon–Tue, causing brief urban/poor-drainage flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents along Long Island and New Jersey beaches through the weekend.
